t: Amazon's History: Bookstore to Tech Giant Guide
s: October 2, 2024 - Amazon.com officially launched on July 16, 1995, quickly gaining traction among early adopters of online shopping. The company's customer-centric approach and vast selection of books set it apart from traditional retailers.

t: Amazon At 25: A Fascinating Journey Through Retail History
s: July 11, 2019 - In July 1994, Jeff Bezos founded Amazon.com. Twenty-five years later, he is the wealthiest man in the world and Amazon controls 50% of the online business in the U.S.

Amazon houses its in-house brand offerings under the “Our Brands” label, which is separate from exclusive brands.

t: History of Amazon: Company and Stock
s: Amazon’s other largest current brands emerged in the early 2000s. It began accepting third party sellers for the first time in 2000. Amazon Web Services launched in 2002, having emerged from a series of internal tools used to run the company’s website.
